narrative.title: Eighth Army 8Th Army - 1942Q2
narrative.situation: British Field Army deployed in North Africa during 1942Q2.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain (Gazala Line) transitioning to rocky desert and sand dunes inland. Wadis and escarpments create defensive positions.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain (Gazala Line) transitioning to rocky desert and sand dunes inland. Wadis and escarpments create defensive positions.

aggregate_strength.note: Aggregate strength from Wikipedia Battle of Gazala (22 June 1942: 463 total, 420 operational). Squadron details from Nafziger Collection (26 May 1942). Per-squadron strength estimated using RAF standard establishment of 16 aircraft per squadron.

air_support.organizational_summary: 21 operational units providing air support to ground forces

source.title: British Western Desert Air Force, 26 May 1942

air_support.integration_note: Air forces data integrated from quarterly air summary. See british_1942q2_air_summary.json for detailed squadron/gruppo breakdown.
